item.title: When is a Freeze Dryer not a Dehydrator?
item.description: I have a theory I intend to explore. These “Freeze Dryers” ($$$). that people are buying, are really a “Class” of Dehydrators; a class that does NOT use HEAT to dehydrate. A good example is: In my younger days, when we use to help Mum with the laundry (in the winter). Back in my generation, we use to use a clothesline, and we use to hang laundry out to dry. In the (very) cold weather, the laundry use to freeze to the clothes line.

item.title: Soup1
item.description: Rainbow Lentil Soup Spices: (in paper cup) 1 teaspoon Dried Garlic Chips 1/2 teaspoon Cumin 1/2 teaspoon Coreander 1 teaspoon Smoked Paprika 1 Bayleaf 1 teaspoon Lemon Powder 1/4 teaspoon Salt 1/4 teaspoon Pepper In plastic Baggie: 1/2 Cup Dehydrated Carrots 1/2 Cup Dehydrated Onions 1/2 Cup Deyhdrated Celery 1 Can (15 oz.) Crushed Tomatoes 1 Quart Water
